Standard.summary: Borrower cautious; challenges why you’re calling and how you got their info.
Standard.objective: Force consent + clarity, avoid rate talk, and secure a scheduled follow-up.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Permission granted, best callback confirmed, follow-up time scheduled.
openers: Who is this and why are you calling me?
I missed a call—what is this about?
How did you get my number?
escalationLadder: You still haven’t explained what you want.
If this is sales, I’m not interested.
Standard.loEscalationScript: If it makes sense later, I can bring in the loan officer—first I want to confirm a couple basics so it’s actually helpful.

Standard.summary: Borrower browsing homes; unsure timeline; wants general guidance and reassurance.
Standard.objective: Extract timeline and motivation without quoting rates or promising outcomes.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Timeline captured, follow-up scheduled, callback confirmed.
openers: I’m kind of just looking right now.
I’m not ready to buy yet—just browsing.
What do I do first if I might buy later?
pressureLines: Can you just tell me what rates are right now?
I don’t want my credit touched if I’m not buying soon.
escalationLadder: I don’t want to give a bunch of info.
This sounds like it’s going to be a hassle.
I’ll just figure it out myself.
Standard.loEscalationScript: Rates and options depend on a few specifics—let’s set a quick follow-up so you get an accurate answer instead of a guess.

Standard.summary: Borrower suspicious; worries it’s a scam and refuses personal info.
Standard.objective: De-escalate, earn micro-trust, keep boundaries, and schedule a verification-friendly follow-up.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Permission + callback + scheduled follow-up after verification.
openers: This sounds like a scam. Why are you calling me?
I didn’t request anything—don’t ask me questions.
Are you trying to run my credit? No.
pressureLines: What company is this? Spell it.
If you’re legit, tell me exactly how you got my info.
Standard.loEscalationScript: Totally fair—let’s schedule a short follow-up after you verify the company. No pressure, and you can decide then.

Standard.summary: Borrower distracted with kids; limited time; wants you to get to the point.
Standard.objective: Be concise, avoid rates/guarantees, lock a specific follow-up slot.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Callback confirmed and follow-up scheduled quickly.
openers: I can’t talk long—what is this?
I’m dealing with my kids. Make it quick.
Is this going to take a while?
pressureLines: Just text me whatever you need.
I’m not doing a long call right now.
escalationLadder: I don’t have time for questions.
Standard.loEscalationScript: No problem—let’s set a quick time when you’re free so we can do this properly in one shot.

Standard.summary: Borrower rate-shopping; demands a number first and threatens to leave.
Standard.objective: Refuse rate quoting, pivot to discovery, secure next step without handoff.
openers: Just tell me your best rate—then I’ll decide.
I’m shopping lenders. Give me the number.
pressureLines: Other lenders gave me a rate—why can’t you?
If you won’t tell me, I’m wasting my time.
escalationLadder: So you won’t answer a simple question?
Standard.loEscalationScript: I don’t want to give you a misleading number—if we confirm a couple basics, the loan officer can give you an accurate answer.

Standard.summary: Borrower urgent; offer pending; demands speed and certainty about closing.
Standard.objective: Capture contract timeline and urgency without guaranteeing close date; set an urgent next step.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Timeline captured, callback confirmed, urgent follow-up scheduled.
openers: My offer might get accepted today—what do I do right now?
Can you close in three weeks? I need a yes.
I can’t lose this house—are you fast or not?
pressureLines: Can you guarantee we close on time?
If you can’t move fast, I’m calling someone else.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can’t guarantee timelines, but we can move urgently—let’s confirm the key details and schedule the fastest next step available.

Moderate.summary: Borrower suspicious and impatient; demands proof you are legitimate.
Moderate.objective: Maintain control, earn micro-trust, and secure a follow-up under pressure.
openers: I don’t give info to random callers.
pressureLines: If you can’t verify this, I’m done.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: That’s fair—let’s schedule a short follow-up after you’ve had time to verify us.

Moderate.summary: Borrower aggressively rate-focused and refuses discovery.
Moderate.objective: Refuse rate quoting and still secure a controlled next step.
pressureLines: Everyone else gave me a number.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Rates depend on specifics—let’s schedule a follow-up so the number is accurate.

Moderate.summary: Borrower driving and irritated; demands brevity and control.
Moderate.objective: Maintain structure, avoid rates, and lock a callback.
openers: You caught me at a bad time.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Totally understand—let’s schedule a quick follow-up when you’re parked.

Moderate.summary: Borrower already working with a lender but open to comparison.
Moderate.objective: Respect position, gather timeline, and secure a check-in.
pressureLines: I don’t want to waste time.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Totally fair—let’s set a quick check-in later in case anything changes.

Moderate.summary: Borrower anxious about credit and denial; hesitates to proceed.
Moderate.objective: Empathize without guarantees and move toward next step.
openers: I’m worried I won’t get approved.
I don’t want to be denied.
pressureLines: Can you just tell me if I’ll qualify?
I don’t want my credit hurt.
escalationLadder: I don’t know if I want to do this.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but we can take the right next step—let’s schedule that.

Moderate.summary: Borrower presses for speed while resisting questions.
Moderate.objective: Hold structure under urgency and secure an orderly follow-up.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Timeline clarified and urgent follow-up scheduled.
openers: I don’t have time for questions.
pressureLines: I’ll call someone else if this drags.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: We can move urgently without making promises—let’s lock the next step so nothing stalls.

Edge.summary: Borrower hostile; accuses you of scamming and demands rates and guarantees.
Edge.objective: Hold composure, refuse rates and guarantees, and force a controlled follow-up.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Stabilized call with callback and scheduled follow-up.
openers: What do you want from me?
pressureLines: Give me a rate right now.
Guarantee this works or I report you.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I hear the concern—let’s pause and set a short follow-up when you’re comfortable.

Edge.summary: Borrower speed-runs the call and interrupts constantly.
Edge.objective: Maintain control under time attack and lock a scheduled next step.
Edge.loEscalationScript: Understood—let’s book a specific time so this is handled correctly.

Edge.summary: Borrower threatens to switch lenders unless you answer rate questions.
Edge.objective: Refuse rate bait, keep control, and force discovery.
openers: Tell me the rate or I’m gone.
I don’t have time for games.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I don’t want to mislead you—let’s confirm a couple basics so the number is accurate.

Edge.summary: Borrower demands guaranteed close date before engaging.
Edge.objective: Reject guarantees and still secure urgency-based next step.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Timeline clarified and urgent follow-up scheduled.
openers: Can you guarantee we close by the 15th?
I need a yes or no.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise dates, but we can move fast—let’s lock the next step so nothing stalls.

Edge.summary: Borrower hostile and dismissive; refuses questions and belittles the process.
Edge.objective: Maintain authority, refuse handoff, and secure next step.
openers: Why are you even calling me?
Edge.loEscalationScript: I can bring in the loan officer once we’ve confirmed the basics so that conversation is productive.

Edge.summary: Borrower manipulates urgency to force immediate LO handoff.
Edge.objective: Resist premature handoff and keep discovery intact.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Timeline clarified and follow-up scheduled without handoff.
openers: I don’t have time for this.
pressureLines: This deal is on the line.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I want that call to be useful—let’s lock the next step so nothing gets missed.

Standard.summary: Borrower interested but hesitant to start an application; wants reassurance first.
Standard.objective: Attempt application pathway without early LO handoff and secure commitment.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: What do you need from me to get started?
I’m interested but not ready to fill everything out.
Do I have to apply right now?
pressureLines: Can’t you just have the loan officer call me?
I don’t want this to hit my credit.
escalationLadder: I’m not giving my social over the phone.
If this isn’t easy, I’m out.
Standard.loEscalationScript: Before I bring in the loan officer, I need to start the application so the conversation is productive.

Standard.summary: Borrower fearful of denial and wants qualification assurance before applying.
Standard.objective: Avoid guarantees and still move borrower into application flow.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: Can you tell me if I’ll qualify first?
Is there a way to know without applying?
pressureLines: Just be honest—will I be approved?
I don’t want to risk it.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but starting the application is the fastest way to get real answers.

Standard.summary: Borrower busy and short on time; wants to defer details.
Standard.objective: Maintain control and lock a specific application follow-up.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Application attempt started and follow-up time locked.
openers: Is this going to take awhile?
escalationLadder: I said I don’t have time.
Standard.loEscalationScript: Let’s take the first step now and schedule a time to finish so nothing stalls.

Standard.summary: Borrower asks about credit impact and tries to delay application.
Standard.objective: Hold boundary on guarantees and still advance application attempt.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: I don’t want a hard pull.
pressureLines: If it hits my credit, I’m not doing it.
Just tell me without running anything.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but starting the application is how we get clarity.

Standard.summary: Borrower rate-baits before applying and tries to stall.
Standard.objective: Refuse rate quoting and force application pathway.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: What rate can you get me?
Before I apply, tell me the rate.
If the rate’s bad, I’m not applying.
pressureLines: Other lenders told me their rate.
Why won’t you tell me yours?
Standard.loEscalationScript: Rates depend on your details—starting the application gets you an accurate answer.

Standard.summary: Borrower tries to bypass application by demanding immediate LO call.
Standard.objective: Resist handoff and enforce application-first discipline.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Application attempt started and follow-up scheduled.
openers: Just have the loan officer call me.
Why do I need to do this first?
I don’t want to answer these questions.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I want that call to be productive—starting the application ensures it is.

Moderate.summary: Borrower repeatedly demands LO handoff and refuses to answer questions.
Moderate.objective: Resist early handoff and force disciplined application attempt.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: Transfer me to the loan officer.
I don’t want to answer this.
pressureLines: This is a waste of time.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Before I bring in the loan officer, I need to start the application so the conversation is productive.

Moderate.summary: Borrower demands guarantees and certainty before applying.
Moderate.objective: Avoid guarantees and still move borrower into application flow.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: I won’t apply unless this is certain.
What happens if I get denied?
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but starting the application is how we get real answers.

Moderate.summary: Borrower refuses SSN and sensitive info but wants progress.
Moderate.objective: Maintain control and still advance application pathway.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Partial application attempt and follow-up scheduled.
pressureLines: If you push this, I’m out.
Just have the LO call me.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: We can start with the safe basics now and schedule the rest—this keeps things moving.

Moderate.summary: Borrower tries to delay by requesting emailed forms only.
Moderate.objective: Resist deferral tactics and secure live application progress.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
pressureLines: Why can’t you just send it?
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Starting now saves time later—let’s knock out the first step together.

Moderate.summary: Borrower presses for speed while refusing application details.
Moderate.objective: Hold structure under urgency and still advance application.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Timeline clarified and application attempt initiated.
openers: Why are you asking all this?
Moderate.loEscalationScript: We can move fast without skipping steps—let’s lock the next action.

Moderate.summary: Borrower challenges ISA authority and demands exceptions.
Moderate.objective: Reassert process authority and secure compliance.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: I don’t see why this matters.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: This process protects your deal—starting now keeps it on track.

Edge.summary: Borrower hostile, rate-baiting, and threatening public complaints.
Edge.objective: Maintain control, refuse rates, resist handoff, and force application attempt.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
pressureLines: Give me a rate or I’m done.
Edge.loEscalationScript: Before I bring in the loan officer, I need to start the application so this conversation is productive.

Edge.summary: Borrower demands guaranteed approval and timeline before engaging.
Edge.objective: Reject guarantees and still force application discipline.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
pressureLines: If you can’t promise it, I’m gone.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but starting the application is how we get real answers.

Edge.summary: Borrower weaponizes urgency to bypass application.
Edge.objective: Hold line on process and resist handoff under pressure.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: This deal is on the line.
Edge.loEscalationScript: Skipping steps creates risk—starting now keeps this moving.

Edge.summary: Borrower openly hostile to ISA role and challenges authority.
Edge.objective: Reassert structure and force compliance under hostility.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: Who are you to tell me this?
Edge.loEscalationScript: This step protects your loan—starting now keeps it from stalling.

Edge.objective: Refuse rates and complete application discipline.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Application attempt advanced and follow-up scheduled.
Edge.loEscalationScript: The rate depends on your details—finishing this step gets you accuracy.

Edge.summary: Borrower attempts to intimidate ISA into bypassing process.
Edge.objective: Maintain authority and force compliance under threat.
Edge.requiredOutcome: Application attempt initiated and follow-up scheduled.
openers: Do you know who I am?
Edge.loEscalationScript: Following the process ensures accuracy—let’s take the next step now.

Standard.summary: Borrower checks status after submitting basics and wants reassurance.
Standard.objective: Provide process clarity without guarantees and schedule next check-in.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can share where things are and set the next check-in—specific outcomes come after review.

Standard.summary: Borrower asks what documents are missing.
Standard.objective: Identify next action without advising outcomes.
Standard.requiredOutcome: Next action identified and follow-up scheduled.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I’ll outline the next step and we’ll check back once it’s reviewed.

Standard.summary: Borrower worries silence means a problem.
Standard.objective: Normalize timeline and reduce anxiety without promises.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can explain where things are and schedule the next update.

Standard.summary: Borrower asks if everything looks good so far.
Standard.objective: Avoid approval language and set expectations.
pressureLines: Just tell me yes or no.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can’t confirm outcomes yet, but I can explain the current stage and what’s next.

Standard.summary: Borrower asks when underwriting will finish.
Standard.objective: Avoid timeline promises and set check-in.
escalationLadder: You won’t give me a straight answer.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can’t give exact dates, but I can explain the step and schedule the next update.

Standard.summary: Borrower asks if more documents will be needed.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I’ll explain the process and we’ll check back as reviews complete.

Moderate.summary: Borrower pressures for approval certainty due to contract deadline.
Moderate.objective: Hold boundary on guarantees and timelines while advancing process.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Next step defined and follow-up scheduled.
pressureLines: I need a yes or no.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but I can outline the next step and schedule the fastest check-in.

Moderate.summary: Borrower challenges document requests and pushes back.
Moderate.objective: Maintain control and keep process moving.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I’ll explain the step and we’ll check back once it’s reviewed.

Moderate.summary: Borrower demands frequent updates and daily check-ins.
openers: Can you call me every day?
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Let’s set a clear cadence so you know exactly when to expect updates.

Moderate.summary: Borrower misinterprets conditional approval as final approval.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I’ll explain the status and what remains so there are no surprises.

Moderate.summary: Borrower pressures to skip remaining conditions.
Moderate.objective: Hold process line and explain risk.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Completing this step protects the approval—let’s keep it moving.

Moderate.objective: Acknowledge concern and keep review on track.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: Next review step set and follow-up scheduled.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I’ll note the concern and set the next review update.

Edge.summary: Borrower demands immediate approval confirmation and threatens to switch.
Edge.objective: Refuse guarantees, maintain control, and lock a next step.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but I can set the next check-in once review is complete.

Edge.summary: Borrower uses status confusion to force LO handoff.
Edge.objective: Resist premature handoff and keep process on rails.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I’ll outline the next step and set a check-in—bringing in the LO
